title: My Main AI: The AI Capital Surge and the Search for the Next Breakout Market
description: As billions of dollars flood into artificial intelligence, investors are drawing comparisons to the early crypto bull markets, when emerging technologies, rapid experimentation, and real-world adoption created rare opportunities for outsized returns.

title: 'AI mirrors' are changing the way blind people see themselves
description: Artificial intelligence is helping blind people access visual feedback about their bodies, sometimes for the first time. The impact on their mental health is only just emerging.
content:
Artificial intelligence is helping blind people access visual feedback about their bodies, sometimes for the first time – but the emotional and psychological consequences are only just starting to emerge.

title: Reading's head of AI explains ambition to be pioneers as League One club looks for an edge to reach the Premier League

title: How financial advisors can use ChatGPT to work more efficiently-without losing the human touch
description: Artificial intelligence can be a valuable tool for client communications and other time-consuming tasks, allowing advisors more time to focus on their core competencies.

title: A year after the DeepSeek crash, markets face a new Chinese AI threat
description: The company took down the artificial-intelligence market in early 2025. A year on, there is still reason to pay attention to Chinese AI.

title: European Union opens investigation into Musk's AI chatbot Grok over sexual deepfakes
description: LONDON — The European Union opened a formal investigation into Elon Musk's social media platform X on Monday after his artificial intelligence chatbot Grok spewed nonconsensual sexualized deepfake images on the platform.

title: 97% Firms Expand Privacy Programmes As AI Drives Data Protection Push, Cisco Report Reveals
description: As artificial intelligence adoption accelerates, 97 per cent of companies have expanded their privacy programmes, according to a Cisco report. Nearly 96 per cent plan to invest more in data protection. In India, all surveyed firms reported business benefits such as improved innovation and customer trust, though many still struggle with AI data governance challenges.
content:
New Delhi: As artificial intelligence rapidly becomes part of everyday business, 97 per cent of companies have already expanded their privacy programmes, a new report said on Monday.
